Class ShipBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.managers.ShipBoard
public class ShipBoard extends Object
The ShipBoard class represents the grid-based structure of a spaceship in the Galaxy Trucker game. It manages the placement, retrieval, and removal of components on the ship, ensuring structural integrity and connectivity.

This class includes functionalities such as:

  • Defining ship boundaries based on different levels.
  • Adding and removing components.
  • Identifying and managing connected components.
  • Checking exposed connectors for connectivity validation.

The ship is represented as a matrix (tileMatrix) where each cell contains an Optional<ComponentTile>, indicating the presence or absence of a component.

Example of usage:

     ShipBoard ship = new ShipBoard();
     ship.setShipBounds(1); // Initialize ship boundaries for level 1
     ship.addComponentTile(2, 3, new EngineModule());

Example of usage:

     ShipBoard ship = new ShipBoard(1); // Create and initialize ship boundaries for level 1
     ship.addComponentTile(2, 3, new EngineModule());
Version:
1.2
Author:
Stefano Carletto

  • Constructor Details

    • ShipBoard

      public ShipBoard(Color playerColor)
      Initializes a new ShipBoard instance, representing the ship's component grid. The board is structured to accommodate ship components and maintain their positions.

      Upon creation, the board is empty, and no components are placed.

    • ShipBoard

      public ShipBoard(int level, Color playerColor)
      Initializes a new ShipBoard instance for a specified ship level. The board is structured to accommodate ship components and automatically applies the appropriate structural boundaries based on the given level.

      Upon creation, the board is empty except for predefined structural constraints OutOfBoundsTile and the default CentralCabin.

      Parameters:
      level - The level of the ship (e.g., 1 or 2), determining its valid structure.

  • Method Details

    • getShipBoard

      public List<List<ComponentTile>> getShipBoard()

    • getBoard

      public List<List<Optional<ComponentTile>>> getBoard()
      Retrieves the entire board as a matrix of component tiles.
      Returns:
      A List<List<Optional<ComponentTile>>> representing the board. Each inner list corresponds to a row, and each Optional<ComponentTile> represents a cell that may contain a component or be empty.

    • getComponent

      public Optional<ComponentTile> getComponent(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the component located at the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component.
      column - The column index of the component.
      Returns:
      An Optional<ComponentTile> containing the component if present, or Optional.empty() if the cell is empty.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If row or column are out of bounds.

    • getAllComponentsTypes

      public Set<Class<? extends ComponentTile>> getAllComponentsTypes()
      Retrieves all unique component types currently placed on the ship.
      Returns:
      A set of classes representing the different types of components present on the board.

    • getAllComponentsPositionOfType

      public Set<List<Integer>> getAllComponentsPositionOfType(Class<? extends ComponentTile> componentType)
      Retrieves all positions of components of the specified type on the board.
      Parameters:
      componentType - The class type of the component to search for.
      Returns:
      A Set<List<Integer>> containing the coordinates of all components of the given type, where each coordinate is represented as List<Integer> [row, column]. Returns null if the component type is not found.

    • getNeighbourComponents

      public List<Optional<ComponentTile>> getNeighbourComponents(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the neighboring components of the specified position on the board. The neighbors are returned in the following order:
      • Upper component
      • Right component
      • Lower component
      • Left component
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the target component.
      column - The column index of the target component.
      Returns:
      A List<Optional<ComponentTile>> containing the neighboring components. Each element in the list is Optional.empty() if the corresponding neighbor does not exist.

    • getBranchOfComponent

      public void getBranchOfComponent(int row, int column, Set<List<Integer>> branch)
      Recursively identifies and collects all connected components in a ship's grid, starting from a specified position. This method performs a depth-first search (DFS) to explore all adjacent components that are part of the same connected structure.

      The method stops under the following conditions:

      • If the specified position is outside the grid boundaries.
      • If the component at the specified position is either empty or marked as an OutOfBoundsTile, indicating an invalid or unoccupied position.
      • If the component at the specified position has already been visited and added to the branch.

      Once a valid component is found, it is added to the branch set, and the method recursively explores its four neighboring components (top, right, bottom, left) to continue the search.

      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component to start the search from.
      column - The column index of the component to start the search from.
      branch - A set that stores coordinate pairs (row, column) representing all connected components that belong to the same structure.

    • getDisconnectedBranches

      public List<Set<List<Integer>>> getDisconnectedBranches()
      Identifies and groups all disconnected branches of connected components within the ship's grid. A branch is defined as a set of connected components that form a continuous structure.

      This method iterates through the grid and performs a depth-first search (DFS) to find all disconnected clusters of components. Each unique branch is stored as a set of coordinate pairs representing the connected components.

      The method follows these steps:

      • Iterate through all positions in the tileMatrix.
      • Ignore empty tiles or tiles marked as OutOfBoundsTile, as they are not part of a branch.
      • If a component has not been visited, perform a recursive search using getBranchOfComponent(int, int, Set) to collect all connected components.
      • Add the discovered branch to the set of all branches.

      Each branch is represented as a Set<List<Integer>>, where each list contains two integers: (row, column).

      Returns:
      A list of disconnected branches, where each branch is a set of coordinate pairs representing connected components.

    • setShipBounds

      public void setShipBounds(int level)
      Sets the boundaries of the ship by marking positions outside the valid ship structure with OutOfBoundsTile components based on the specified level. Also initializes the board placing a CentralCabin at the center of the ship
      Parameters:
      level - The level of the ship (e.g., 1 or 2).

    • addComponentTile

      public void addComponentTile(int row, int column, ComponentTile component) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Adds a component to the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the component should be placed.
      column - The column index where the component should be placed.
      component - The ComponentTile to be added.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If a component is already present at the specified position or if the specified position is outside the ship.

    • removeComponentTile

      public ComponentTile removeComponentTile(int row, int column) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalComponentPositionException
      Removes the component from the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component to be removed.
      column - The column index of the component to be removed.
      Returns:
      The removed component
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If there is no component at the specified position.

    • removeBranch

      public Set<ComponentTile> removeBranch(Set<List<Integer>> branch) throws IllegalComponentPositionException
      Removes all components in a given branch from the ship's grid. This method iterates through the provided set of coordinates and removes each corresponding component by calling removeComponentTile(int, int).

      If any coordinate in the branch refers to an invalid position or an unremovable component, the method will throw an IllegalComponentPositionException.

      Parameters:
      branch - A set of coordinate pairs (row, column) representing the components to be removed.
      Returns:
      A set containing all removed components
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the specified row or column is out of the ship's bounds.
      IllegalComponentPositionException - If the removal of a component at any given coordinate is not allowed due to game rules or invalid positioning.

    • countExposedConnectors

      public int countExposedConnectors(int row, int column)
      Counts the number of exposed connectors for a given component at the specified position. A connector is considered exposed if it is of type SINGLE, DOUBLE, or UNIVERSAL and there is no adjacent component in that direction.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the component.
      column - The column index of the component.
      Returns:
      The number of exposed connectors for the component at the given position. If the position is empty or outside the board, returns 0

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()

    • printBranch

      public void printBranch(int level, Set<List<Integer>> branch)
